content: Which famous scientist developed the three laws of motion and the universal law of gravitation in his work "Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica"?

The famous scientist who developed the three laws of motion and the universal law of gravitation in his work "Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica" is Sir Isaac Newton. His groundbreaking work, published in 1687, laid the foundation for classical mechanics and had a profound impact on the scientific community. Newton's laws of motion describe the relationship between a body and the forces acting upon it, while the law of universal gravitation explains the attractive force between masses. These principles have been fundamental in understanding the physical world and have applications in various fields of science and engineering.
